events.title: Treaty of Paris Ends the Seven Years' War
events.description: The Treaty of Paris was signed, ending the Seven Years' War. France ceded much of its North American territory to Britain, reshaping the colonial map and setting the stage for future American tensions.
events.significance: This treaty significantly altered colonial holdings, impacting the balance of power in North America and leading indirectly to the American Revolution.

events.title: Queen Victoria Marries Prince Albert
events.description: Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom married Prince Albert of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha in London, England.
events.significance: Their marriage influenced British culture and politics, strengthening the monarchy’s role; their partnership became a model of royal and public service.

events.title: First Flight Over Mount Everest
events.description: Aircraft pilots Douglas Douglas-Hamilton, David McIntyre, and Flight Lieutenant D.F. McIntyre completed the first documented flight over Mount Everest.
events.significance: This achievement marked a milestone in aviation and exploration, demonstrating advanced aerial capabilities at high altitudes.

events.title: Unabomber Manifesto Published
events.description: The Washington Post and The New York Times published the manifesto of Ted Kaczynski, the Unabomber, following a demand from the FBI.
events.significance: The publication was a pivotal moment in the investigation, leading to Kaczynski’s identification and capture, ending a nationwide bombing campaign.
